'Birch Evans "Evan" Bayh III' ( ; born December 26, 1955) is a lobbyist, lawyer,
and former Democratic politician who served as the junior U.S. Senator from
Indiana from 1999 to 2011. He earlier served as the 46th Governor of Indiana
from 1989 to 1997.

Bayh first held public office as the Secretary of State of Indiana, elected in
1986. He held the position for only two years before being elected Governor
where he successfully advocated for state welfare reform, tax cuts, and fiscal
discipline. He left his office after completing two terms and briefly took a job
lecturing at Indiana University Kelley School of Business, before being elected
to the U.S. Senate seat once held by his father, Birch Bayh.

On February 15, 2010, Bayh announced he would not seek reelection to the Senate
in 2010. After leaving the Senate, he became a partner with the law firm
McGuireWoods in the firm's Washington, D.C., office, and would serve as a
senior adviser with Apollo Global Management. He was hired as a Fox News
contributor in March 2011. On October 27, 2011, it was announced
that Berry Plastics Corp. appointed Bayh to its board of directors.
Bayh also serves on the board of directors of Marathon Petroleum, the 2011 spin-
off from Marathon Oil.
